website_summaries.verdict: Osmo's starter kit includes everything a child will need for future app downloads and game kits. Game play is very engaging, even if the software itself can be glitchy at times. Ideal for first-time Osmo system owners.
pros: Strong appeal with computer-savvy users – very engaging apps
Works well with the special needs population
cons: Technical issues can affect interest and engagement
Some gameplay is difficult to understand

customer_reviews.title: This game is worth EVERY cent!
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this game I tested it out with teachers. We were laughing out loud so much that other people popped their heads in the room to see what were were doing! I tested it with kids - same reaction. I created a "DonorsChoose" request to get Osmo for my students and it was funded. The kids ASK to play the game again. Kids who are not in my class asked how much the game was - they wanted to tell their parents to purchase it for them. GREAT game! Well worth your money! Better still, you can create your own games and play them yourself.
customer_reviews.author: MS FACS teacher

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son who absolutely loves it! He has used it for hours & hours and never had any issues. If my son, the resident "tech" junkie is so happy with this system it's got to be a home run!
customer_reviews.author: Dru

customer_reviews.title: I love it! It keeps her attention
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 6 and loves this! Hell, I love it! It keeps her attention, teaches her spelling, we can play this as a team or as 'fierce' competitors (who will win it all!) Either way she is learning and being creative. A must have!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this for my 10 year old granddaughter's birthday and she loves it. She has draws some beautiful pictures and she loves the games. It's new so I haven't seen all it can do, but, so far, 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma G

customer_reviews.title: Two very happy children x
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful product . The apps are keeping my children aged 5 and 9 engaged for hours. I love the fact that both children can increase their spelling and vocabulary in a fun way. My 5 year old loves matching the shapes and both children like that they can learn to draw better. An overall very good purchased to which I am very pleased and extremely impressed. I am glad I purchased two of these so my children can both play with the different apps at the same time. I would definitely recommend these to my family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: sue farrow

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages
customer_reviews.text: My children (4, 9, 11) LOVE Osmo! My oldest loves Masterpiece, my middle child loves Newton and the youngest loves Tangram! I love the fact that they are LEARNING while playing and having fun! Great product. (Also, the packaging is pretty nifty, magnetized storage boxes!)
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Malik

customer_reviews.title: Tangible Play
customer_reviews.text: Our little one really got a lot of enjoyment out of this game set, and still does. I was immediately drawn in by the commercial promoting this product and it lives up to the excitement. Its a great way to pull your little one back into tangible play by bringing them outside the ipad sort of speak. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RAIL19

customer_reviews.title: Osmo Rocks at our house
customer_reviews.text: The gaming system is as described. My 5yo loves it, and it's challenging enough to where he needs some help. But after he figures it out, he's so happy about his accomplishment. The drawing part takes some getting used to, but he also enjoyed it. It's definitely something you can play with the family. Technology is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby V

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Using it in my classroom! It is the hottest station when students have choice!
customer_reviews.author: Ivey Powell

customer_reviews.title: This set is amazing! I am a pediatric OT and absolutely love ...
customer_reviews.text: This set is amazing! I am a pediatric OT and absolutely love this set. It is great for perceptual skills, discrimination when locating letters from a group, hand eye coordination, motor planning, spatial relations using tangagrams, and cooperative play. What a great addition to ipad activities for kids!
customer_reviews.author: OTKid

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME..
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME...!!!!! Bought this for Vietnam Veteran husband who has dementia from Agent Orange...Took him a little bit to work it; but he did....and he LOVES it....!!!!! It is great for hand and eye coordination...His favorite is Masterpiece. In the past, he was able to draw and sketch anything. Now with Parkinson's, it's difficult. Masterpiece gives him a little of that back. And of course, our Grandkids like playing it with Poppy...!!!! <3
customer_reviews.author: STERLING

customer_reviews.title: Very cool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Turns the ipad into a game for my toddlers. They love it and while some of the games are a little too complicated for them right now, I am sure it will used a lot more than it is now in the future.

If you order from their website they will send one for free to a teacher. And it's the same price as on Amazon with free shipping!

customer_reviews.title: This is the Educational-App you have been looking for
customer_reviews.text: As subtle and fun as Monument Valley and clever as Quiver (formerly ColarMix), it gets kids thinking usefully abstract dimensions. Tanagrams: beyond learn by doing, a subtle lesson in following instructions. Newton: the logical evolution of pinball -- play is limited only by your imagination, lego figurine work too! Masterpiece: Teaches hand eye coordination and body awareness -- only rote imitation would result if the image were projected. Words: Open ended and simply amazing!

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars, but should cost less
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars, but.... I have bought two of these so far, at around $80 each. They are incredible. I love them! That being said, I think the price should be more around $50. But with the free software and the potential for artists, it is still an ok deal. It will allow anyone with patience and decent hand/eye coordination to draw like a professional. My 6 year old has drawn pictures using it that are incredible. My 3 year old loves the word games, and they both enjoy the shape puzzles. For a designer, artist, teacher, cartoonist, this is an amazing tool. I just think $80 is a tad high for what is in the box.

product_meta.title: Osmo - Starter Kit Original - for iPad (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Osmo learning games makes it fun for children to learn, using Toys as Teaching Tools. Osmo is Magic! In 2013, Osmo created a fun-filled & award winning learning games that interact with actual hand held pieces & an iPad and/or Fire Tablet, bringing a child's game pieces & actions to life (No WiFi necessary for game play). Osmo merges tactile exploration with innovative technology, actively engaging children in the learning process. Osmo games develop a wide range of skills, varying skills based on each game, including: Creativity, Problem-Solving, Confidence Gaining, Child-Led, Hands-On, Gender-Neutral, Curriculum Inclusion, Social/Emotional Skills, STEM/STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering Math & Art) and many more educational capabilities. Games are designed for children between the ages of 3-11+ and include beginner to expert levels. OSMO enables the continuation of learning. Parents can track game progress, using child game profiles, on a parent app. Shapes & placing in designs (Tangram), problem solving/early physics (Newton), creative drawing skills (Masterpiece), letters, spelling & vocabulary (Words). Approved by parents and teachers worldwide, used in over 30,000 classrooms. Tag your photos on social media with #Osmomagic to be featured!

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 


Bridge the physical and digital In this digital age, the iPad offers young minds a great platform for learning and playing. But, when kids are interacting only with a touchscreen, they're spending less time engaging with their physical world. Osmo is a technology system that bridges the physical and digital worlds by taking gameplay beyond the screen.

Anyone, anytime, anywhere Osmo isn't just for kids. Designed for anyone aged 6 and up, this educational toy can be enjoyed by nearly everyone in the family. Siblings can challenge each other in Words, best friends can work together in Newton, or dad and daughter can sweat it out in Tangram. Kids, parents, grandparents, and friends alike can play with Osmo anywhere, anytime. Even at Grandma's house, where there's no WiFi connection.


Works with all iPads Osmo is compatible with all versions of iPad 2 and up, all versions of iPad mini and all versions of iPad Air.


Easy to setup Set your iPad on the stand, place the red reflector over your iPad's camera, and you’re ready to play!


Awards Osmo has gotten rave reviews from USA Today, Yahoo! Tech, The Wall Street Journal, and more! Time Magazine named Osmo one of the top inventions of 2014.



Our Games Kids and adults alike can cultivate their minds and creativity through Osmo's games: Newton: 60+ levels of creative engineering. Guide virtual balls with real-life objects. Words: Unlimited content. Guess and spell hidden words with physical tiles. Tangram: 500+ visual and spatial puzzles. Arrange puzzle pieces to build challenging shapes. Masterpiece: Draw anything and everything. Supercharge your drawing skills. ?and more to come... 

About the Startup 
What is Osmo’s mission?

It has become a common sight to see so many kids with faces glued to screens disconnected from the world around. Interaction of tablets inspired us to invent Osmo which opens up iPad to the endless possibilities of physical play. Our mission is pretty simple - design holistic play experiences that are loved by children, parents and teachers alike.

How does Osmo work?

Osmo consists of a base and a red reflector. The reflector enables the iPad to read the environment in front of it, on the table. Powered by Osmo's revolutionary Reflective AI technology, the reflector brings real-life actions and movements into the digital world on your iPad.

What do you imagine for Osmo’s future

The team at Osmo wants to open up the doors to creativity and allow any content, language or education subject to be brought to life. The unique technology in Osmo enables a mixed media spanning both digital and physical worlds. We want you to be able to shape your own experience. This is just the beginning of a play movement that will bring together kids and adults alike.
feature_bullets: OSMO IS MAGIC: Fun-filled & award winning learning games that interact with actual hand held pieces & an iPad, bringing a child's game pieces & actions to life (No WiFi necessary for game play).
AGE & CAPABILITY: Ages 6-10+. Games are designed for beginner to expert levels. OSMO enables the continuation of learning. Track game progress, using child game profiles, on a parent app.
TEACHING: Shapes & placing in designs (Tangram), problem solving/early physics (Newton), creative drawing skills (Masterpiece), letters, spelling & vocabulary (Words).
WHAT'S IN THE BOX: OSMO Classic Base for iPad, Tangram pieces, Numbers tiles, Words tiles, Stackable storage for each game & 4 Game Apps: Tangram, Words, Newton, and Masterpiece.

OSMO PROMISE: Designed with fun & learning in mind, in Palo Alto, California. 90 day Warranty. An iPad & OSMO Base (iPad is not included) are required to play. Compatible with iPad 2-6, iPad Mini 1-4, iPad Air 1-2, iPad Pro 9.7 & 10.5 inch. Fire Tablet is not compatible with this base.
